img.alt: This is the image for the news article titled Information about COVID-19

div.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-size: small; font-family: verdana, sans-serif;

p.style: color: rgb(55, 66, 69); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 14px; background-color: rgb(225, 241, 234);
p.span: The Louisiana Department of Education continues to closely monitor the Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) outbreak. Below is a collection of information about COVID-19, as well as resources for educators and families. All resources will be updated on an ongoing basis.

strong.style: color: rgb(55, 66, 69); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 14px; background-color: rgb(225, 241, 234);

span.style: color: rgb(55, 66, 69); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 16px; background-color: rgb(225, 241, 234);

a.style: color: rgb(55, 66, 69); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(225, 241, 234);

span.style: color: rgb(55, 66, 69); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(225, 241, 234);

a.style: color: rgb(55, 66, 69); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(225, 241, 234);
a.strong: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

span.style: color: rgb(55, 66, 69); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(225, 241, 234);

span.span: websites also maintain updated information about COVID-19, prevention, and occurrences.

div.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-size: small; font-family: verdana, sans-serif;
color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-size: small; font-family: verdana, sans-serif;
div.span: This information can be found at https://www.louisianabelieves.com/resources/covid-19

div.div: Delhi Charter School adheres to the equal opportunity provisions of federal civil rights law and regulations that are applicable to this agency. Therefore, no one will be discriminated against on the basis of race, color, national origin (Title VI of the Civil Rights Act of 1964); gender (Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972); disability (Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973) in attaining educational goals and objectives and in the administration of personnel policies and procedures.
